TopicTitle: Loading screen says Loading asset bundle deffinition on Windows 10

Articles.Content: When I load KSP its says Loading asset bundle deffinition on Windows 10 and even if a reinstall it it still doesnt work
@SpaceandSea It's meant to say that during the loading process. Is it getting stuck at that stage for you?

54 minutes ago, RealKerbal3x said:

@SpaceandSea It's meant to say that during the loading process. Is it getting stuck at that stage for you?

Yeah it is

On 11/9/2020 at 7:16 PM, SpaceandSea said:

Yeah it is

1)How much Ram your system has?

2)Did you try running KSP as administrator, right click KSP inside the games folder and run as admin

3)Are you on steam?Do you have cloud saving enabled?If yes disable and do a full re install

4)Some suggested deleting the KSPedia folder inside Gamedata->Squad fixes that problem

5)Do you have any mods?'

Edited November 11, 2020 by Boyster

Can you please read this and follow the steps to first troubleshoot, and then if that doesn’t work get the logs and share them so someone can try and figure out the problem:

Check the KSP.log file inside the KSP directory, if you see a crash or exception at the end then that’s a big clue to what’s going wrong.

Hello folks! I recently stumbled across this load issue. Hopefully y’all above got it sorted out, though what I can say is it wasn’t a memory loss. For some godforsaken reason, windows update made my other drive need administrative privileges… smh 

This means ModuleManager CANT make the patches needed to continue.

simply go to KSP install dir, right click both KSP .exe (Launcher/KSP_64) go to compatibility then check run as administrator. 
 

this loads game every time with privilege. 
(sorry for late post but I wanted others to benefit from my fix)
 

Thanks, Jake
